title: Spitfire - Fuel To Burn 2015 ak61
description:
Already in the first track late Spitfire on 'Fuel to Burn' know what it stands for: straightforward hard rock played from the lower abdomen. The phrase "I got a rocket in my pocket" is sufficient in fact as review. You know even all exactly what you get.

This Norwegian hard rock band was founded in 2006 and now has three plates in his pocket. 
The most recent achievement listens as saying to the name 'Fuel To Burn'. Do not expect innovative music.
 
Spitfire received a multitude of unadulterated hard rock in the line of Van Halen and Danko Jones. 
The Scandinavian quartet knows what a good song must meet and that has resulted in a strong album. 
'Fuel To Burn' contains chunky riffs, catchy choruses and strong hooks. The songs linger and are all very catchy.
 
At its core, this is pop music, but includes screaming and abrasive guitars. 
Thanks to a clear production, all the tools to their fullest. Yet this record has a sleazy edge. 
It sounds namely just some vicious and dirtier than you're used to the genre.


Tracklist

01. Fuel To Burn
02. Damned If You Do
03. Dogfight
04. Nightmare
05. Far Away
06. Gimme Some
07. I
08. Down
